Sounds good, and as far as what Tuscon intends, I don't mind running wi=
th that intention and seeing where things land :) <br><br>I will let Airly =
post for Hydras and crew before I post. <br><br>Oh, and I sent you some pri=
vate email :)<br>

<br>Preston<br><br><br><br><div class=3D"gmail_quote">On=
 Sun, Jan 23, 2011 at 8:16 PM, Sandy <span dir=3D"ltr"><<a href=3D"mailt=
o:magicquartz@..." target=3D"_blank">magicquartz@...</a>></s=
pan> wrote:<br><blockquote class=3D"gmail_quote" style=3D"border-left: 1px =
solid rgb(204, 204, 204); margin: 0pt 0pt 0pt 0.8ex; padding-left: 1ex;">

<div style=3D"background-color: rgb(255, 255, 255);">
<span>=
=A0</span>


<div>
  <div>


    <div>
      
      
      <p>You were righ=
t.  I did delete that post and I rewrote it.  Tucson hasn't moved, he&#=
39;s signalled Noctorro to move in slowly, and in phases.  He's going t=
o now stand back and let the fuzors begin their work.  But he's also go=
ing to give the impression of complete surrender at the same time.  <br>


=
<br>
Meanwhile, Uproar and Quickstride are completely at a loss as to how t=
o fix things at the Ark.  And now, they're going to look up to Rodimus =
to do the right thing.  Both of them are rookie Maximals, so do expect some=
 comic relief from those two.  Uproars biggest weakness is his perpetual cu=
riosity which is harmless enough but often gets him into sticky situations.=
  Quickstride's weakness is often his scatterbrained nature, which also=
 provides a little comic relief.  If Rodimus can put these two guys on the =
right track, then he shouldn't have any reasons to doubt himself as a l=
eader.<br>


<br>
Hope this helps. BTW, Tucson is willing to meet with Lega=
cy, on neutral grounds, but feels it's best that Legacy does leave the =
Ark for saftey purposes.  Remember, he does have that weakness for losing h=
is temper, and he may have made it sound rather harsh, when he informed Leg=
acy that he was to vacate the Ark.  But in doing so, he could privately mee=
t with the bot to try and get an idea as to what page he's actually on,=
 and why he's doing what he's doing.  And if he has indeed turned e=
vil.  Tucson is extremely confused as to why Legacy would intentionally har=
m his comrades, and he's hiding confusion behind his anger.  But he wil=
l not make any violent actions against him, he just wants honest answers.  =
<br>


<br>
Okay, that's definitely it for now.    Haven't gone thi=
s far yet, just something to run by you before we go with it.</p><div><br>
